Computer Graphics Programming Assignment
  • Question Fifteen
  • View page source

Question Fifteen

Circuit-layout programs are variants of paint programs. Consider the design of logical circuits using the Boolean and, or, and not functions. Each of these functions is provided by one of the three types of integrated circuits (gates),the symbols for which are shown in Figure below. Write a program that allows the user to design a logical circuit by selecting gates from a menu and positioning them on the screen. Consider methods for connecting the outputs of one gate to the inputs of others.

Introduction

This code demonstrates an advanced logical circuit designer using PyQt5. The designer allows users to create and connect various logic gates.

Class Structure

  1. Gate: Represents a generic logic gate with a specified type (AND, OR, NOT).

  2. GateInput: Represents an input terminal of a gate.

  3. GateOutput: Represents an output terminal of a gate.

  4. Connection: Represents a connection between the output of one gate to the input of another gate.

  5. CircuitScene: QGraphicsScene subclass responsible for managing gates and connections.

  6. CircuitDesigner: Main QWidget for the application, containing the QGraphicsView and the CircuitScene.

Gate Class

class Gate

Represents a generic logic gate in the circuit.

Variables:

  • gate_type (str) – Type of the gate (e.g., “AND”, “OR”, “NOT”).

  • width (int) – Width of the gate.

  • height (int) – Height of the gate.

  • inputs (list) – List of input terminals.

  • outputs (list) – List of output terminals.

  • bounding_rect (QPointF) – Bounding rectangle for the gate.

  • opacity (float) – Opacity of the gate.

  • parent (QGraphicsItem) – Parent item of the gate.

__init__(gate_type, x, y)

Initializes a new Gate instance.

Parameters:

  • gate_type (str) – Type of the gate.

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the gate’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the gate’s position.

boundingRect()

Returns the bounding rectangle of the gate.

Returns:

QRectF

paint(painter, option, widget)

Paints the gate on the QGraphicsView.

Parameters:

  • painter (QPainter) – QPainter instance.

  • option (QStyleOptionGraphicsItem) – Style options.

  • widget (QWidget) – QWidget being painted.

Returns:

None

contextMenuEvent(event)

Handles the context menu event for the gate.

Parameters:

event (QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent) – Context menu event.

Returns:

None

hoverEnterEvent(event)

Handles the hover enter event for the gate.

Parameters:

event (QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent) – Hover event.

Returns:

None

hoverLeaveEvent(event)

Handles the hover leave event for the gate.

Parameters:

event (QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent) – Hover event.

Returns:

None

add_input(x, y)

Adds an input terminal to the gate.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the input terminal’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the input terminal’s position.

Returns:

None

add_output(x, y)

Adds an output terminal to the gate.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the output terminal’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the output terminal’s position.

Returns:

None

update_connections()

Updates the connections between gates.

Returns:

None

GateInput Class

class GateInput

Represents an input terminal of a gate.

Variables:

parent_gate (QGraphicsItem) – Parent gate to which the input belongs.

__init__(parent_gate, x, y)

Initializes a new GateInput instance.

Parameters:

  • parent_gate (Gate) – Parent gate.

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the input terminal’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the input terminal’s position.

GateOutput Class

class GateOutput

Represents an output terminal of a gate.

Variables:

parent_gate (QGraphicsItem) – Parent gate to which the output belongs.

__init__(parent_gate, x, y)

Initializes a new GateOutput instance.

Parameters:

  • parent_gate (Gate) – Parent gate.

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the output terminal’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the output terminal’s position.

Connection Class

class Connection

Represents a connection between the output of one gate to the input of another gate.

Variables:

  • start (QPointF) – Start point of the connection.

  • end (QPointF) – End point of the connection.

__init__(start, end)

Initializes a new Connection instance.

Parameters:

  • start (QPointF) – Start point of the connection.

  • end (QPointF) – End point of the connection.

update_path()

Updates the path of the connection.

Returns:

None

CircuitScene Class

class CircuitScene

QGraphicsScene subclass responsible for managing gates and connections.

Variables:

connections (list) – List of connections in the scene.

__init__()

Initializes a new CircuitScene instance.

contextMenuEvent(event)

Handles the context menu event for the scene.

Parameters:

event (QGraphicsSceneContextMenuEvent) – Context menu event.

Returns:

None

add_gate(gate_type, x, y)

Adds a gate to the scene.

Parameters:

  • gate_type (str) – Type of the gate.

  • x (float) – X-coordinate of the gate’s position.

  • y (float) – Y-coordinate of the gate’s position.

Returns:

None

mousePressEvent(event)

Handles the mouse press event for the scene.

Parameters:

event (QMouseEvent) – Mouse press event.

Returns:

None

CircuitDesigner Class

class CircuitDesigner

Main QWidget for the application, containing the QGraphicsView and the CircuitScene.

__init__()

Initializes a new CircuitDesigner instance.

Returns:

None

initUI()

Initializes the user interface.

Returns:

None
